clinical_study.brief_title: Convalescent Plasma to Limit Coronavirus Associated Complications
clinical_study.official_title: Convalescent Plasma to Limit Coronavirus Associated Complications: An Open Label, Phase 2A Study of High-Titer Anti-SARS-CoV-2 Plasma in Hospitalized Patients With COVID-19

brief_summary.textblock: Researchers are trying to assess the treatment potential and safety of anti-SARS-CoV-2 convalescent plasma in patients with acute respiratory symptoms with confirmed COVID-19.

detailed_description.textblock: High titer human convalescent plasma will be extracted from apheresis donations from twenty recently-sick and currently-recovered COVID-19 patients. An open-label, phase 2A clinical trial will then be conducted to administer convalescent plasma to twenty individuals with confirmed cases of COVID-19 to investigate the novel application of convalescent plasma in the treatment strategy of SARS-CoV-2.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Study stopped due to opening Expanded Access Protocol.

primary_outcome.description: Change in RNA levels of SARS-CoV-2 from nasopharyngeal using RT-PCR (reverse transcriptase polymerase chain reaction) across time.
Total number of subjects to be admitted to the ICU after the anti-SARS-CoV-2 convalescent plasma transfusion.
The total number of days subjects were admitted to the hospital.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 90 days after transfusion or until hospital discharge (whichever comes first)
secondary_outcome.description: The type of supplemental oxygen support (e.g. nasal cannula, high flow nasal cannula, noninvasive ventilation, intubation and invasive mechanical ventilation, rescue ventilation) of the anti-SARS-CoV-2 convalescent plasma group across time.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 90 days after transfusion or until hospital discharge (whichever comes first)
secondary_outcome.description: The total number of days subjects required respiratory support.

arm_group.description: Subjects will receive 1-2 units (300-600 mL) of plasma with an anti-SARS-CoV-2 titer of >1:64.

intervention.description: Anti-SARS-CoV-2 convalescent plasma obtained from patients identified as having recovered from COVID-19 with neutralizing antibody titers >1:64.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients must be 18 years of age or older
- Hospitalized with COVID-19 respiratory symptoms and confirmation via COVID-19 SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR testing. Patient is willing and able to provide written informed consent and comply with all protocol requirements.
- Patient agrees to storage of specimens for future testing.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Female subjects with positive pregnancy test, breastfeeding, or planning to become pregnant/breastfeed during the study period
- Receipt of pooled immunoglobulin in past 30 days
- Contraindication to transfusion or history of prior reactions to transfusion blood products
